bioghist.p: Maybell Sammons Hayes (1895-1981), a medical missionary of the PCUSA, graduated from Grove City College in 1919 and from Woman's Medical College in 1923. Appointed to the India Mission in 1924, Dr. Hayes served at the Fatehgarh Hospital from 1925-1927. From 1927 through 1960, she served as a physician on the staff of the Allahabad Agricultural Institute where her husband, Brewster Hayes, was head of the Institute's Horticulture Department. In 1960, she was sent to the Punjab Synod where she served on the staff of the Ludhiana Christian Medical School until 1962. She was enrolled as a Peace Corps volunteer from 1965 through 1967 and served with the Department of Social and Preventative Medicine, SMS, Medical College, Jaipur, Rajasthan. From 1967 until her return to the U.S. in 1970 she served in Naila, a village in the Jaipur District, where she conducted general clinic work and lectured at the Health Center.

scopecontent.p: This collection is of a scrapbook of photos related to Maybell Hayes' work in India, 1955-1959, including photographs of rural clinics of Jumna Dispensaries, 1944; staff and patients of dispensaries; Hayes working with patients; Nehru visiting Extension Project, 1955; and possibly photos of Hayes' husband in Riverside, California, 1957. The collection also includes several loose photographs, including staff and students of the Allahabad Agricultural Institute, 1951; a 1925 group photograph of staff of the Jumna Dispensaris; 1944 photographs of the Jumna Dispensaries at the Agricultural Institute; and a 1933 group photo of Allahabad Christian College bible teachers and Jumna Church Sunday school teachers.
